item.title: Lyon
item.description: How to Get Around by Public Transportation Public transport: Bus, Metro & Tram TCL: https://www.tcl.fr/en - the network of public transportation in Lyon. This includes: 4 metro lines (MA, B, C, D) 2 cable cars (F1, 2) 7 tram lines (T1-7) 26 high frequency bus lines (C1-26) More than 50 regular frequency bus lines (Bus 1, 2, 3, etc.) Journey Planner: https://www.tcl.fr/en/journey-planner/route-finder [pdf] Map of Lyon Metro, Tram & Bus (TCL): https://www.

item.title: Jacksonville
item.description: How to Get Around by Public Transportation Get around Jacksonville in style on trolleys, the Skyway, buses, water taxis, and the ferry. Search through our transportation companies below. JACKSONVILLE RIVER TAXI The St. Johns River Taxi provides transportation to points on both sides of the St. Johns River in the heart of Downtown (including EverBank Stadium, home of the Jacksonville Jaguars!). Remember, a sunset tour on the River Taxi is one of the best ways to see breathtaking views of the Jacksonville skyline.

item.title: Austin
item.description: How to Get Around by Public Transportation Capital Metro (public transit) Catch a ride with Capital Metro, the public transportation provider in Central Texas. Download the CapMetro App to buy passes and plan trips on the go. Capital Metro provides a network of bus routes, new MetroRapid Route 801 and MetroRail service to keep people moving into and out of downtown and throughout the city. Ground Transportation To and From Austin-Bergstrom International Airport You can find Ground Transportation options, including: taxis, rideshare, shuttles, pedicabs and electric low speed vehicles, limousines, and charter services.

item.title: Naples
item.description: How to Get Around by Public Transportation Collier Area Transit (CAT): This is the primary public transportation system serving the Naples area. CAT operates buses on several routes throughout Naples, as well as in some of the neighboring communities. These buses run on a regular schedule and provide service to many of the major shopping centers, hospitals, and other destinations in the area. https://www.ridecat.com/ Trolley Service: Naples offers a free trolley service that runs from the Naples Pier to the north end of the city.

item.title: Dubai
item.description: How to Get Around by Public Transportation Metro: The Red Line (which has stations at or near most of the major tourist destinations and along The Sheikh Zayed Road), and The Green Line (which has stations along the residential part of the city). Red Line: Runs from Rashidiya to UAE Exchange. Green Line: Connects Etisalat to Creek. Route planner https://www.rta.ae/wps/portal/rta/ae/public-transport/journeyplanner Dubai Tram:The Dubai Tram links the Dubai Metro and the Palm Monorail, making it convenient for you to explore the restaurants and attractions in the JBR district and Palm Jumeirah.

item.title: Taipei
item.description: How to Get Around by Public Transportation Type of transportation: MRT, LRT, Bus, Taxi, Uber, Bike Type of MRT tickets: Admission to the trains is via blue plastic single-journey tokens or electronic stored value cards called EasyCards. Travelers can calculate single journey fare here, which depends on journey distance. Single Journey: NT$20 - NT$65 One-day EasyCards Pass: NT$150 24hr Taipei Metro Pass: NT$180 48hr Taipei Metro Pass: NT$280 72hr Taipei Metro Pass: NT$380 All Pass Ticket: NT$1,280 includes unlimited rides for 30 days on Taipei Metro, Taipei buses, and YouBike bike share.
